thread.title: Astros announce pregame festivities before Game 3 of ALDS
thread.title_full: Astros announce pregame festivities before Game 3 of ALDS

title: Astros announce pregame festivities before Game 3 of ALDS
text:
Astros announce pregame festivities before Game 3 of ALDS Published On: Oct 09 2015 10:31:24 PM CDT Tweet HOUSTON - 
With the Astros hosting their first playoff game in 10 years, the team has several pregame festivities planned Sunday. 
With Dallas Keuchel starting Sunday's game, Keuchel's Korner will be featured in the stands. 
Fans are encouraged to wear orange for Sunday's "Orange Out" game. Quick Clicks Astros set ALDS roster; Reliever Chad Qualls left off 
The Astros released a statement that read, in part: 
"All fans will receive Hustle Town Thunderstixx, presented by Academy Sports + Outdoors, and gates will open at 11:30 a.m. 
"Prior to Sunday’s contest, fans with a game ticket are invited to enjoy a Postseason “Hustle Town” Street Fest, featuring local food trucks, pub games, inflatables and live music from Southbound 45. Houston rapper Bun B will also make an appearance to perform the release of his new song, "Crush City." 
"The Postseason Street Fest begins at 11 a.m. and ends at 2:30 p.m. 
"The Astros pregame field ceremonies will include a flag ceremony featuring 75 Astros Season Ticket Holders. Country music legend Clay Walker will perform the National Anthem, and return to the field for God Bless America during the 7th inning stretch." 
The Royals' win in Game 2 on Friday forced a Game 4 in Houston. Game 4 will be Monday and will start at 12:07 p.m. PHOTOS: Astros vs. Royals in Game 2 of ALDS Published On: Oct 09 2015 03:17:35 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 09 2015 07:18:37 PM CDT
